verses.verse: ((1 David being grievously afflicted, blesseth them that pity his case,9 and complaineth of the treason of his own friends and familiars, as came to pass in Judas, John 500 13:18. After he feeling the great mercies of God gently chastising him, and not suffering his enemies to triumph against him,13 giveth most hearty thanks to God.) ) Blessed is he that judgeth wisely of the poor: the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.
The Lord will keep him and preserve him alive, he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

The Lord will strengthen him upon the (When for sorrow and grief of mind he calleth himself upon his bed.) bed of sorrow: thou hast turned all his (Thou hast restored him in his sick bed and sent him comfort.) bed in his sickness.
Therefore I said, Lord have mercy upon me: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
Mine enemies (That is, curse me and cannot have their cruel hate quenched, but with my shameful death.) speak evil of me, saying, When shall he die, and his name perish?

And if he come to see me, he speaketh (For pretending to comfort me, he conspireth my death in his heart, and braggeth thereof.) lies, but his heart heapeth iniquity within him, and when he cometh forth, he telleth it.
All they that hate me whisper together against me: even against me do they imagine mine hurt.
(The enemies thought by his sharp punishments that God was become his mortal enemy.) A mischief is light upon him, and he that lieth, shall no more rise.

Yea, my (Hebrew, the man of my peace.) familiar friend, whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, (As David felt this falsehood, and as it was chiefly accomplished in Christ, John 13:18, so shall his members continually prove the same.) hath lifted up the heel against me.
Therefore, O Lord, have mercy upon me, and raise me up: so shall I reward them.
By this I know that thou favorest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph against me.

And as for me thou upholdest me (Meaning, either in prosperity of life, or in the true fear of God against all tentations.) in mine integrity, and dost set me before thy (Showing me evident signs of thy fatherly providence.) face forever.
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel world without end. (By this repetition he stirreth up the faithful to praise God.) So be it, even so be it.
